explanation: Include the three direct callees (UtAssert_DoCompare, UtAssert_GetValueText, UtAssert_GetOpText) because the MISRA check must examine their bodies for any use of memcmp to compare null-terminated strings (indirect uses count). Include UtAssertEx because it is invoked by this function (return value) and could contain string comparisons or wrap other routines that use memcmp. Include the standard string/char functions used in this function (strncmp, strchr, isspace, snprintf) because either the source uses them to compare/inspect strings (relevant to whether memcmp is used instead) or their implementations / wrappers in the project could call memcmp; the analyzer must be able to resolve whether they or project-specific replacements call memcmp. Finally include memcmp itself so the next agent can identify any direct uses of memcmp in the target function or reachable callees (the exact symbol to search for).
